sponsor: VA Office of Research and Development
briefTitle: Diagnosis and Treatment of Sleep Apnea in Cerebrovascular Disease
officialTitle: Diagnosis and Treatment of Sleep Apnea in Cerebrovascular Disease

interventions.name: CPAP Therapy for Newly Diagnosed Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA)

summary: Sleep apnea is common among Veterans with cerebrovascular disease (stroke or transient ischemic attack \[TIA\]), leads to hypertension, and is associated with recurrent stroke and death. Although continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) safely treats sleep apnea, few Veterans with cerebrovascular disease are diagnosed with sleep apnea or offered treatment.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: The entire study period (baseline and up to one-year)
